summary: This bill, the "Primary Regulators of Insurance Vote Act of 2025," amends the Financial Stability Act of 2010 to make the State insurance commissioner a voting member of the Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC). It outlines the appointment process for this commissioner, including input from the National Association of Insurance Commissioners. The bill also repeals the provision for a non-voting State insurance commissioner and makes technical and clarifying amendments to the Act, including defining "Council." It aims to integrate state insurance expertise into financial stability oversight.
